@DavidHeffernan You are right. Even if it should not "fail" in most cases, since the DummyStr variable content will just be ignored. In this case, it would be a nightmare bug to track at runtime. So I would not recommend using it, unless you use a threadvar DummyStr: string but I suspect it is slow and resource consuming (threadvars slots are scarce).
